Package backend.tradesystem.managers

Class TradingInfoManager

java.lang.Object
backend.tradesystem.managers.Manager
backend.tradesystem.managers.TradingInfoManager
public class TradingInfoManager
extends Manager
Handles anything about getting info on trading and on traders, but this does not handle trading itself

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    TradingInfoManager()
    Initialize the objects to get items from databases

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.util.ArrayList<Trader> getAllTraders()
    Gets all the traders in the database
    Trader[] getFrequentTraders​(java.lang.String traderId)
    return the 3 most traded with Traders
    java.util.ArrayList<TradableItem> getRecentTradeItems​(java.lang.String traderId)
    Gets a list of the items used in trades
    TradableItem[] getTradableItemsStartsWithName​(java.lang.String name)
    Gets tradable items that has a name that starts with the input name For example, if the item name is "Apple Pie", and the name to check for is "apple", then that TradableItem is included as a list of items to return

  • Constructor Details

    • TradingInfoManager

      public TradingInfoManager() throws java.io.IOException
      Initialize the objects to get items from databases
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if something goes wrong with getting database

  • Method Details

    • getAllTraders

      public java.util.ArrayList<Trader> getAllTraders()
      Gets all the traders in the database
      Returns:
      all the traders in the database

    • getTradableItemsStartsWithName

      public TradableItem[] getTradableItemsStartsWithName​(java.lang.String name)
      Gets tradable items that has a name that starts with the input name For example, if the item name is "Apple Pie", and the name to check for is "apple", then that TradableItem is included as a list of items to return
      Parameters:
      name - the name to check the starts with
      Returns:
      list of tradable items that match the name

    • getFrequentTraders

      public Trader[] getFrequentTraders​(java.lang.String traderId) throws AuthorizationException, UserNotFoundException, TradeNotFoundException
      return the 3 most traded with Traders
      Parameters:
      traderId - the trader being checked for
      Returns:
      a String array of the usernames of the 3 most traded with Traders
      Throws:
      AuthorizationException - user isn't a trader
      UserNotFoundException - user not found
      TradeNotFoundException - trade not found

    • getRecentTradeItems

      public java.util.ArrayList<TradableItem> getRecentTradeItems​(java.lang.String traderId) throws AuthorizationException, TradeNotFoundException, UserNotFoundException, TradableItemNotFoundException
      Gets a list of the items used in trades
      Parameters:
      traderId - the trader id
      Returns:
      list of tradable items that were recently traded
      Throws:
      AuthorizationException - user is not a trader
      TradeNotFoundException - trade not found
      UserNotFoundException - trader id is bad
      TradableItemNotFoundException - tradable item is not found
